alert.note: Alert for Northern Humboldt Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued December 30 at 1:23PM PST until December 31 at 11:00AM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 7 AM TO 11 AM FRIDAY... * WHAT...High astronomical tides will cause minor flooding in low- lying areas along Humboldt Bay and the northern Humboldt Pacific Coast. High tide is predicted to be around 8.4 feet at North Spit around 9 AM Friday morning and tidal anomalies have been running around one half foot above predicted values. Minor flooding is possible when tide levels reach 8.8 feet. * WHERE...Northern Humboldt Coast including Humboldt Bay. * WHEN...From 7 AM to 11 AM Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of lots, parks, and roads with only isolated road closures expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...King Salmon and Jackson Ranch road in the Arcata Bottoms are the most likely places to observe minor flooding. More significant coastal flooding is possible over the weekend. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Coastal Flood Advisory means that onshore winds and tides will combine to generate flooding of low areas along the shore.
